snippet: At least 34 million of the Japanese supplier’s airbags need to be recalled, but automakers have identified and recalled only 16 million cars.
abstract: Seven deaths have now been linked to defective airbags manufactured by Takata, as Honda Motors confirms driver Kylan Langlinais was killed by rupturing airbag inflater in her 2005 Civic in April.
lead_paragraph: At least 34 million of the Japanese supplier’s airbags need to be recalled, but automakers have identified and recalled only 16 million cars.

headline.main: Honda Links a Rupturing Takata Airbag to a 7th Death
headline.print_headline: Honda Links a Rupturing Takata Airbag to a 7th Death
